result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Nmi Morales Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $543 [clerk's calculation: $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $543], to be paid in $50 per month installments [commencing on 9/16/16 and on the 16th day of each month thereafter until paid in full]; non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 15 days in Jefferson County Jail; to commence on or before 6:00am on October 10, 2016 

--[the Court does not allow for any Huber-release for service of this jail sentence] 

Based on ADA Shock's reporting that there is DNA on file, the Court does not order DNA sample provision in this case.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Nmi Morales Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Duplicate original warrant received from JESO - serving time

[MK] case called at 2:58pm. 
Defendant Jesse Nmi Morales in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Morales indicates that he has no objection to the State's Notice to Admit Statements of the Defendant. 
The Court finds that the intended statements are admissible.
Mr. Morales indicates that he is not prepared to proceed to the Jury Trial as scheduled on September 1st.  Mr. Morales would like to finalize the case today; he has been given a plea offer from the State.
Right to counsel given. Mr. Morales indicates that he is waiving this right.  The Court accepts this waiver.
Elements recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.  The Court finds that the Criminal Complaint sets forth a factual basis for the Court to accept a plea.
Mr. Morales pleads "No Contest" to Count #1. 
The Court accepts this plea, finds Mr. Morales guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Morales to:
--serve 15 days in Jefferson County Jail; to commence on or before 6:00am on October 10, 2016 
--[the Court does not allow for any Huber-release for service of this jail sentence] 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $543 [clerk's calculation: $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge= $543], to be paid in $50 per month installments [commencing on 9/16/16 and on the 16th day of each month thereafter until paid in full]; non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Based on ADA Shock's reporting that there is DNA on file, the Court does not order DNA sample provision in this case. 
recess 3:18pm.
of Intent to Admit Statements of Defendant - State's
State's Response to Court's Scheduling Order
Motion hearing on August 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on September 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on August 29, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 11:09 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesse Nmi Morales in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Court reviews case file and indicates that Mr. Morales had previously been represented by Atty Nero and at that time, the Court allowed Atty Nero to withdraw. At that time, Mr. Morales indicated that he would like to represent himseld and the Court found Mr. Morales competent to represent himself
DA Happ informs the Court that Mr. Morales did appear at the DA PTC
Mr. Morales informs the Court that an offer was made at PTC but he did not agree with it
Court informs parties that It will set matter for trial
Clerk distributes scheduling order
Mr. Morales informs the Court that he would like to resolve the matter and not go to trial, Court informs Mr. Morales that his last date to enter plea is the FSSC date
Recess: 11:14 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 8/29/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 9/1/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on June 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 03:40 pm.

Case called at 1:19pm [mo]
Defendant Jesse Nmi Morales in court with attorney Adam P Nero.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Nero motions to withdraw as counsel; submits proposed motion to the Court.
--no position taken by the State

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Morales. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

With consent from Mr. Morales, The Court grants Atty. Nero's motion to withdraw.
The Court gives Mr. Morales his right to counsel

Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Morales indicates he would like to represent himself.
The Court finds Mr. Morales competent to represent himself at this stage of the proceedings
The Court finds that Mr. Morales is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel.


recess: 1:30pm 

NEXT: (1)Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 3:40pm (2)Status Conference on 6/7/16 at 10:30am
for rescheduling of the 3/8/16 status conference
and Stipulation to adjourn the presently scheduled Status Conference on 3-8-2016 - forwarded to Court for review

Case called at 11:06 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesse Nmi Morales in court with Attorney Adam P Nero. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate; nee address given; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues $150 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No contact with Amanda Marshall 
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No acts or threats of violence
-May visit Monroe Street address one time with law enforcement on one occassion to obtain personal belongings by 6:00 pm, 12/31/15
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 11:11 am
